plugins.name: Storylane: Turn Figma into AI-interactive demos
plugins.description:
From Figma screens to killer product demos - powered by AI


Convert your Figma designs into interactive product demos in just a few clicks. Storylane lets you build personalized, AI-enhanced demos directly from your Figma frames - ready for sales, marketing, and presales teams to share across channels.


How it works?

1. Download and open the Storylane plugin

Install the Storylane plugin and open it in your Figma file.

2. Choose which Figma frames to export

Select All frames or just the ones you've highlighted.

3. Pick your destination and click “Create New Demo"

Instantly export your frames to a new demo or to an existing one in Storylane.

4. Fine-tune and enhance with AI features in the Storylane editor

Add voiceovers, guides, personalization, and more — no code needed.

5. Share the interactive demo across channels and track engagement

Embed on websites, use in emails, or send in sales calls — with real-time analytics.


Benefits

  1. Gather actionable feedback before development begins
  2. Showcase the product with just mockups when pitching to investors
  3. Connect design, marketing and sales with a single source of truth


Popular features

  1. AI demo creation - Add professional voiceovers, guides, and annotations in seconds
  2. 6+ guide types - Multiple guide types available to create the perfect interactive experience
  3. Instant personalization - Personalize content to prospects without rebuilding demos
  4. AI video avatars - Choose lifelike stock avatars or your replicas to narrate your product story
  5. Multilingual capability - Create demos in 25+ languages with 63+ voice options
  6. Multi-chapter demos - Create choose-your-own-adventure experiences so buyers can explore what matters most to them
  7. Lead generation - Use native or custom lead forms to collect leads at the right moment
  8. Conversion boosters - Add always-available CTAs that significantly increases CTR rate


Deploy anywhere

  1. Embed on websites to convert visitors
  2. Attach to emails for higher engagement
  3. Create immersive offline event experiences
  4. Share as leave-behinds after sales calls
  5. Build custom demo hubs for buying committees


Join 4000+ marketing and sales teams who use Storylane to turn designs into measurable business impact.

Proof of trust - 600+ reviews and the highest satisfaction rating on G2.


First time using Storylane?

See how it works by exploring our interactive product demo or sign up for a free account to get started right away.


For personalized guidance, schedule a call with a demo expert who can show you how to maximize your results.
plugins.tagline: From Figma mockups to interactive demos for feedback, pitching, and showcasing

plugins.name: Bulk image exporter
plugins.description:
Speed up your workflow by exporting all images from your Figma page in just one click! This plugin collects every image and packs them into a handy ZIP file — no more exporting one by one.


You can also set a size limit (default: 1MB) to automatically compress images without losing too much quality. Perfect for quick exporting, sharing assets with devs and optimizing performance.


Features:


  1. Export all images on the current page in a ZIP file
  2. Set max size per image (e.g. 1MB or less)
  3. Check the current download status.
  4. Download each image individually


👉 Please note: this plugin is currently in beta, feedback is welcome!

accepted.name: Lorenzo Brandimarte
accepted.description: Product and UI Designer | No-code developer

plugins.tagline: Export every image on your page in a single ZIP

plugins.name: Designlens
plugins.description:
DesignLens is your AI design assistant — built right inside Figma.

Get instant, actionable feedback on your designs so you can iterate faster, ship smarter, and design with confidence.


Design reviews are often slow, inconsistent, and filled with vague feedback like “make it cleaner” or “this doesn’t feel right.” You’re left guessing what to fix — or worse, waiting days just to hear back.

DesignLens fixes that. With just a click inside Figma, DesignLens analyzes your screen and gives you detailed feedback — instantly.


⚙️ How it works:

1. Select any frame in Figma

2. Run the DesignLens plugin

3. Get clear, structured feedback in seconds



🔍 What it does:


1. UI/Visual Analysis

Get insights on layout, hierarchy, accessibility, consistency, and overall clarity.

We don’t just point out issues — we tell you what’s working, what needs fixing, and how to fix it.


2. Heuristic Evaluation

Your design is evaluated against proven usability principles (like error prevention, recognition over recall, and user control) — helping you catch friction points before users do.


👀 Coming soon:

- UX flow-level analysis

- Business goal alignment


We're just getting started.


📬 Feedback or questions?

Reach us anytime at trydesignlens@gmail.com
plugins.tagline: Design Feedback made Accessible

plugins.name: Consistent contacts
plugins.description:
This plugin allows you to create your own data structure (text or image) and than fill the data into your frames based on matching layer and key name. You have to have the data structure in a predefined JSON format. Example:

{

"records": [

{

"photo": { "image": "avatar-01.jpg" },

"name": "John Doe",

"id": "1234",

"phone": "+1 110-1234",

"company": "TechNova Inc.",

"position": "Software Engineer",

"email": "john.doe@technova.com"

}

]

}

The JSON can be ZIPped with images to a single file, which you can drop to the plugin and populate the frames. The populated frames have to be wrapped together in a parent frame or a component instance works as well. All the frames or instances have to be selected directly to be populated correctly.


WEBP image format is not supported by Figma. JPG and PNG formats works. The whole ZIP file has to be smaller than 1MB, which is a memory limit for any plugin. The ZIP file is remembered, even if you close the plugin, but it is removed from memory and replaced by a new one, if you select a new file.


Not being a developer myself, this is my very first attempt to create a Figma plugin with a huge help from AI. I was able to make it into a working prototype, but there might still be some glitches. If the plugin does not work correctly, check the ZIP content, JSON structure and correct naming of the images. If the plugin stops to work, try to "Clear memory" via a dedicated button. It should reset everything and clean the memory of the plugin.
plugins.tagline: Fill in consistent connected data to your frames

plugins.name: Hilbert
plugins.description:
Weave unique patterns with FASS curves.


FASS stands for 'space-Filling, self-Avoiding, Simple, and Self-similar curves' and they allow you to generate intricate patterns that are made with a single line. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Space-filling_curve


How to use:


1) Select an object on your document and press "Pick".


->Your object will then be displayed as a clipping mask to help you preview the result.


2) Play.


3) Press "Place" to apply your artwork to the selected object.


-> The artwork will be clipped inside the object's geometry.


4) Select another object and press "Pick" to apply it as a the new clipping mask.


NOTE: For performance reasons this version is limited to a maximum of 5 iterations.


----------------------------------------------------------------

Want to support the development of free features and plugins?

You can buy me a coffee!

accepted.name: Eduardo Barbosa
accepted.description: Creative Technologist. I build tools and systems that enhance quality of life, unlock new possibilities, and empower teams and individuals.

plugins.tagline: Discover the creative potential of space-filling curves in Figma.

plugins.name: figma-lokalise-unofficial-plugin
plugins.description:
Unofficial Lokalise Plugin.


Enhance Your Design Workflow with Our Figma Plugin for Lokalise


Our plugin bridges the gap between Figma and Lokalise, offering a seamless integration that streamlines your design localization process. With this tool at your disposal, you can:


Link Texts Between Figma and Lokalise: Easily connect text elements from your Figma designs with corresponding texts in Lokalise, ensuring consistency and accuracy across your project.


Update All Texts with One Click: Synchronize all your design texts with Lokalise in just one click. This feature ensures that all your text elements in Figma are up-to-date with the latest translations and content changes.


Switch Texts to Different Languages Instantly: Our plugin allows you to effortlessly change the language of text elements in your Figma designs. This capability is perfect for quickly adapting your designs to various language markets.


Set Individual Text Elements: Gain the flexibility to specify translations for each text element within Figma individually. This feature provides the precision needed for customizing specific parts of your design to suit different linguistic contexts.


Full demo here: https://youtu.be/VPveQklO4OE


Support me at Patreon ❤️

plugins.name: PSD Importer for Figma
plugins.description:
Import your PSD files directly into Figma. It preserves the design elements such as layer structure, text properties, and complex styles, offering a smooth transition from Photoshop to Figma.


There are 2 import methods.

  1. Import all layers with maximum compatibility.
  2. Import each layer is bitmap image.


While the plugin strives for high accuracy, some discrepancies may occur due to differences between Photoshop and Figma’s rendering engines - particularly with complex effects, blending modes, and certain layer styles. In cases where features can’t be translated, some layers may be imported as images.


Users can try the plugin with three free PSD imports, after which unlimited access is available through an $8/month subscription.
plugins.tagline: Easily import your PSD files in just a few clicks.

plugins.name: Thumb Zone AI
plugins.description:
The Thumb Zone plugin enables you to add your frames to the platform and test it with your users. This plugin can be used for mobile UIs and allows you to perform various types of tests such as UI audit, predicting user behavior, conducting tests with synthetic users, as well as testing with real users to study their emotions.


To add a file from Thumb Zone to Figma, follow the steps below:


  1. Install the plugin.
  2. Define a new product in Thumb Zone.
  3. Select the "Import from Figma" option in Thumb Zone.
  4. Generate a token.
  5. Enter the received token in the Figma plugin.
  6. Select the frames.
  7. Sync!


Frames are synced to Thumb Zone screens, build and test your flow!


Visit https://thumbzone.ai to create your account.

plugins.name: Version Stack
plugins.description:
Version Stack allows you to create and manage multiple versions of selected frames in Figma with ease. Each version is automatically saved with a timestamp and arranged in a dedicated “Version Stack” page using an auto-layout for seamless tracking. Forget manual duplication—this plugin ensures that your design iterations are neatly organized and easily accessible.


How to Use:


1.Select a frame you want to save as a version.

2.Run the plugin, and click 'Save Version' . A new version with a timestamp will be saved in the “Version Stack” page.

3.Each version is stacked vertically in an auto-layout, allowing you to track the evolution of your design effortlessly.


Important Note:

The frame name must remain the same for new versions to be added to the existing version stack.


Limitations:


•Works only with Frame nodes.

•Ensure the “Version Stack” page is not renamed manually to avoid issues.


We Value Your Feedback:

We’re constantly looking to improve! If you have any suggestions, feedback, or feature requests, please share them with us. Your input will help make Version Stack even better for you and the design community. Thank you for using our plugin!
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly save and manage design versions in an organized layout

Atlases:

  2. Bundle or combine atlases for streamlined export.

GUI Nodes:


  1. Design Defold GUI templates as simple frames in Figma.
  2. Fully leverage Figma's design tools without any limitations from Defold's side.
  3. Edit additional GUI node properties using the custom editor.
  4. Export GUI templates as they are, or bundled with atlases and other resources.

plugins.name: FigTextExporter
plugins.description:
# FigText Exporter: AI-Powered Translation Export Plugin for Figma


Transform your Figma text layers into translation-ready JSON files instantly with FigText - the smart localization assistant for designers and developers.


## Key Features


- *Automatic Text Detection:* Scans your Figma files and identifies all text layers that need translation

- *Smart JSON Generation:* Creates structured JSON translation files with nested keys based on your design hierarchy

- *Multi-Language Support:* Export translation files for multiple languages simultaneously

- *Context Preservation:* Maintains the original context of text elements for more accurate translations


## Benefits


- *Time Savings:* Convert hours of manual work into seconds of automated processing

- *Improved Workflow:* Seamlessly integrate with your development pipeline

- *Error Prevention:* Reduce human error in translation file creation

- *Team Efficiency:* Perfect for small teams looking to streamline their localization process


🚀 Stop spending valuable time on manual translation file creation. Let FigText handle the tedious work while you focus on what matters most - creating amazing designs.


## How It Works


1. Select your text layers in Figma

2. Run FigText plugin

3. Choose your target languages

4. Get your translation-ready JSON files instantly


Perfect for developers and designers who want to maintain productivity without getting bogged down by repetitive localization tasks.
plugins.tagline: Easily export and translate text from figma projects

        ],

            "title": [

                "ログイン"
            ]
        }

How to use


  1. Specify text layer name according to the JSON hierarchy structure. (e.g. ) general.back or stage1.S_information.title
  2. Select the element you want to change.
  3. Launch plugin.
  4. Upload json file from button.
  5. If you select Language index "0",
  6. and press "Update word",
  7. then, for example, the value of text layer named "general.back" will be replaced to "back".


  • If the Target node is "Only selected Nodes", only selected elements are replaced. If "All", all elements are replaced. (The "All" option may not be able to process pages of enormous size.)
  • The language designation is an array number, so any numbers of languages can be added.

plugins.name: Chameleon
plugins.description:
🦎 CHAMELEON


Chameleon is a Figma plugin that turns color token management into a breeze. Build smart palettes, structure tokens, and export directly into native Figma Variables.



🎨 KEY FEATURES


🎨 Smart palette generation — create harmonious color ramps from a single base color


🌒 Auto dark theme — instantly generate dark versions of your palettes


♿ A11Y mode — contrast-optimized palettes that meet WCAG accessibility standards


🧷 Figma Variables export — full support for collections, modes, and cross-collection aliases


📤 JSON import/export — compatible with Figma Variables and Token Studio


✏️ Flexible structure — rename shades, palettes, collections, and modes while preserving links



🌒 AUTO DARK THEME


Instantly generate perceptually balanced dark palettes based on your light theme.


How it works:

  1. Inverts brightness scale: lightest shade (50) becomes darkest, darkest (900) becomes lightest
  2. Base color remains at position 500
  3. Brightness follows a perceptual (non-linear) scale
  4. Saturation is increased for dark shades, reduced for light ones
  5. Additional correction ensures visual harmony



🎨 BASE MODE


Best for:

  1. Creating aesthetic palettes without strict contrast rules
  2. Branding and accent color systems
  3. Visually balanced UIs with emphasis on artistic control


Generation logic:

  1. Base color is placed at center (shade 500)
  2. Builds out lighter (50–400) and darker (600–900) shades
  3. Brightness and saturation adjust relative to the base



♿ A11Y MODE


Palettes generated with perceptual brightness, ensuring strong contrast between shades.


Best for:

  1. Interfaces requiring WCAG compliance
  2. Government, medical, educational and fintech products
  3. Inclusive design for wide audiences


Generation logic:

  1. Builds a scale of perceived brightness
  2. Base color is positioned where its brightness fits best
  3. Shades are calibrated for target contrast
  4. Contrast between neighbors ≥ 1.3:1



📌 HOW TO USE


  1. Create your base palettes in the "Global" tab (5 to 15 shades)
  2. Enable A11Y mode if needed
  3. Switch between light and dark themes to evaluate the result
  4. Export everything to Figma Variables or JSON
  5. Youtube



⚙️ UINDER YHE HOOD


  1. HSL-based ramp generation
  2. Edge brightness: Light — 95% → 20%, Dark — 15% → 85%
  3. Auto positioning of base color (especially in A11Y mode)
  4. Built-in WCAG contrast checker
  5. Visual base marker (★)
  6. Full support for Figma Variables & Token Studio structure



🚧 STATUS


This plugin is in beta. We welcome feedback and are actively improving it.
plugins.tagline: Color token generator with automatic shade scales and Figma Variables export

  1. Base color is placed at center (shade 500)
  2. Builds out lighter (50–400) and darker (600–900) shades
  3. Brightness and saturation adjust relative to the base



♿ A11Y MODE


Palettes generated with perceptual brightness, ensuring strong contrast between shades.


Best for:

  1. Interfaces requiring WCAG compliance
  2. Government, medical, educational and fintech products
  3. Inclusive design for wide audiences


Generation logic:

  1. Builds a scale of perceived brightness
  2. Base color is positioned where its brightness fits best
  3. Shades are calibrated for target contrast
  4. Contrast between neighbors ≥ 1.3:1



📌 HOW TO USE


  1. Create your base palettes in the "Global" tab (5 to 15 shades)
  2. Enable A11Y mode if needed
  3. Switch between light and dark themes to evaluate the result
  4. Export everything to Figma Variables or JSON
  5. Youtube



⚙️ UINDER YHE HOOD


  1. HSL-based ramp generation
  2. Edge brightness: Light — 95% → 20%, Dark — 15% → 85%
  3. Auto positioning of base color (especially in A11Y mode)
  4. Built-in WCAG contrast checker
  5. Visual base marker (★)
  6. Full support for Figma Variables & Token Studio structure



🚧 STATUS


This plugin is in beta. We welcome feedback and are actively improving it.

plugins.name: BizTag - Name Tag Generator
plugins.description:
Automating the name tag design process


Conferences, case comps, and hackathons make up the highlights of many student's time in universities. Why? Because they combine hands-on learning, creativity, teamwork, networking, and the thrill of solving real-world challenges in a lively, collaborative environment.


If you've ever attended one of these events, you might notice that professional partners have name tags around their neck. Designing these name tags can take hours of manual work to make the layouts consistent and audit for content mistakes. But what if all that work could be done with the click of a button?


Meet BizTag


BizTag is a powerful Figma plugin that is built by a designer, for designers. The app communicates with Figma's Plugin API to build a series of clean, customizable, and organized name tags.


All it takes is a background image with a resolution of your choosing, and a .csv file populated with information on your event partners, and you can generate dozens of name tags instantly. The plugin automatically places name, company, and pronouns on the frontside, and generates a QR code to place on the backside using a QR code API.


Each frame comes with auto layout, enabling ease of customizability for the designer.


Schema


The schema is as follows:


type Partner = {
firstname: string;
lastname: string;
position: string; // Position @ Company
pronouns: string; // etc. They / Them
linkedin: string; // LinkedIn Profile URL
};

type PartnerList = Partner[];


where the .json / .csv file is taken as a single PartnerList object.
plugins.tagline: Automate your graphic design process

plugins.name: IconPilot
plugins.description:
🚀 IconPilot: The Ultimate Icon Management Plugin for Your Design System!


Say goodbye to hours of manual work prepping icons for your design system. IconPilot simplifies converting your individual stroke and outline icons into fully customizable multi-variant components in seconds, streamlining your workflow and maintaining consistency across your design system.


✨ Key Use Cases:

  1. Quickly convert hundreds of stroke or outline icons into organized multi-variant components.
  2. Define custom sizes, stroke widths, and colors once—then apply effortlessly across your entire icon set.
  3. Maintain design consistency using Figma variables to automatically sync icon properties.


🔧 Seamless Workflow:

  1. Select your icons (components or frames).
  2. Set variant names, sizes, stroke widths, and colors (raw values or Figma variables).
  3. Click convert—IconPilot instantly generates neatly organized icon components ready for your design system.


💡 Powerful Features:

  1. Bulk convert from single icons to thousands at once.
  2. Intelligent Figma variables filtering—only relevant variables appear for size, stroke, or color fields.
  3. Auto-generated search-friendly descriptions to effortlessly find icons in assets.
  4. Persistent configurations—set once, reuse endlessly within your file.
  5. Figma-native UX for seamless integration into your workflow.


Elevate your design system management. Try IconPilot now and spend your valuable time designing, not managing icons.
plugins.tagline: Convert individual icons into multi-variant component sets quickly and consistently.

Hi there! I built this plugin to solve a problem I face every day: transferring text styles between Figma files.

plugins.name: FrameSwapper | Frame to Component
plugins.description:
✨Overview

FrameSwapper is a powerful Figma plugin that helps you replace multiple frames with the same name with a selected component. Perfect for design system implementation and large-scale design updates.


✨ Key Features

  1. 🔍 Smart frame detection: Automatically finds all frames with the same name
  2. 🖼️ Visual preview: Shows thumbnails of both frames and components
  3. ⚡ Batch replacement: Replace multiple frames at once
  4. 🎨 Component integrity: Maintains original component dimensions and properties
  5. 🔎 Search functionality: Quickly find components by name
  6. 📱 Clean UI: Modern, intuitive interface


🛠️ How It Works

  1. Select any frame in your design
  2. Click "Find Matching Frames" to detect similar frames
  3. Choose which frames to replace (or use "Select All")
  4. Pick a component from the available list
  5. Click "Replace" to transform your frames


💡 Use Cases

  1. Implementing design system components across multiple frames
  2. Updating old designs with new component versions
  3. Standardizing repeated elements across your design
  4. Converting prototype frames into component instances


🆕 Version 1.0.0 Updates

  1. Initial release with core functionality
  2. Smart component replacement system
  3. Visual preview system
  4. Search and filter capabilities
  5. Batch selection and replacement
  6. Modern, user-friendly interface

plugins.name: IcoSun
plugins.description:
What is Icosun?

Icosun is an open sourced replacement for Icomoon. Its a tool that allows you to convert SVG icons into web fonts. It ensures icons are scalable, accessible, and efficient for web and app development


What does the plugin export?

  1. Source SVGs - A folder containing all raw SVGs used to generate the font files. Ideal for mobile tech stacks that don't support font files as an icon input.
  2. JSON Unicode Map - A key-value mapping between icon names and the unicode values, making it easy to reference icons in your code.
  3. TypeScript Unicode Map - A TypeScript constant that maps SVGs to their unicode representations, allowing direct usage in TypeScript projects.
  4. Combined SVG - A merged single SVG file that links path data to the unicode values, providing a visual reference for your font set.
  5. Font Files - IcoSun generates all major font file formats, ensuring compatibility across different platforms. It outputs TTF, EOT, OTF, WOFF and WOFF2.


What makes IcoSun different?

  1. Duplicate Prevention - IcoSun detects duplicate icons and warns you before export, reducing manual errors in large icon sets.
  2. Simulate Output - SVG-to-font conversion often faces path-winding issues, leading to incorrect subtractions. With IcoSun, you can preview the final output inside Figma before exporting, minimizing unexpected rendering issues.


IcoSun is fully open source, feel free to make changes to the logic as you like 😀
plugins.tagline: Generet font file for your icon library
